definitions: A person chosen or appointed to act or speak for another or others.
A person chosen or elected to speak and act on behalf of others in a legislative assembly or deliberative body.
A delegate who attends a conference, negotiations, etc., so as to represent the interests of another person or group.
An agent of a firm who travels to potential clients to sell its products.
An employee of a travel company who lives in a resort and looks after the needs of its holidaymakers.
An example of a class or group.
